question_text:
The point T(4,4) is translated 6 units down. What are the coordinates of the resulting point, T'?
T' = (_, _)
backend_description: The image shows a coordinate grid labeled from -6 to 6 on both axes. A green point labeled T is located at (4, 4) in the first quadrant.
solution: Move the point down 6 units. Subtract 6 from the y-coordinate to get (4,-2).
solution_image_tag: The image shows a coordinate grid labeled from -6 to 6 on both axes. A green point labeled T is located at (4, 4) in the first quadrant.
The image shows the same coordinate grid with the green point T now moved down 6 units. The new purple point T' is located at (4, -2) in the fourth quadrant.
